edu.stanford.nlp.simple

Class Sentence

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.simple.Sentence

  • public class Sentence
extends Object
    A representation of a single Sentence. Although it is possible to create a sentence directly from text, it is advisable to create a document instead and operate on the document directly.
    Author:
    Gabor Angeli

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Document document
      The document this sentence is derived from

      • Sentence

        protected Sentence(Document doc,
                   Properties props)
        Create a new sentence, using the specified properties as the default properties.
        Parameters:
        doc - The document to link this sentence to.
        props - The properties to use for tokenizing the sentence.

      • Sentence

        public Sentence(String text,
                Properties props)
        Create a new sentence from some text, and some properties.
        Parameters:
        text - The text of the sentence.
        props - The properties to use for the annotators.

      • Sentence

        public Sentence(String text)
        Create a new sentence from the given text, assuming the entire text is just one sentence.
        Parameters:
        text - The text of the sentence.

      • Sentence

        protected Sentence(java.util.function.Function<String,Document> doc,
                   List<String> tokens,
                   Properties props)
        The actual implementation of a tokenized sentence constructor

      • Sentence

        public Sentence(List<String> tokens)
        Create a new sentence from the given tokenized text, assuming the entire text is just one sentence. WARNING: This method may in rare cases (mostly when tokens themselves have whitespace in them) produce strange results; it's a bit of a hack around the default tokenizer.
        Parameters:
        tokens - The text of the sentence.

      • Sentence

        protected Sentence(java.util.function.BiFunction<Properties,String,Document> docFn,
                   CoreNLPProtos.Sentence proto,
                   Properties props)
        Create a sentence from a saved protocol buffer.

                   CoreNLPProtos.Sentence.Builder proto,
                   Properties defaultProps)
        The canonical constructor of a sentence from a Document.

        doc - The document to link this sentence to.
        proto - The sentence implementation to use for this sentence.

      • Sentence

        protected Sentence(Document doc,
                   CoreMap sentence)
        Helper for creating a sentence from a document and a CoreMap representation

      • Sentence

        public Sentence(CoreMap sentence)
        Convert a CoreMap into a simple Sentence object. Note that this is a copy operation -- the implementing CoreMap will not be updated, and all of its contents are copied over to the protocol buffer format backing the Sentence object.
        Parameters:
        sentence - The CoreMap representation of the sentence.

      • Sentence

        public Sentence(SentenceFragment sentence)

        Convert a sentence fragment (i.e., entailed sentence) into a simple sentence object. Like Sentence(CoreMap), this copies the information in the fragment into the underlying protobuf backed format.

        Parameters:
        sentence - The sentence fragment to convert.

    • Method Detail

      • caseless

        public Sentence caseless()
        Make this sentence caseless. That is, from now on, run the caseless models on the sentence by default rather than the standard CoreNLP models.
        Returns:
        A new sentence with the default properties swapped out.

      • cased

        public Sentence cased()
        Make this sentence case sensitive. A sentence is case sensitive by default; this only has an effect if you have previously called caseless().
        Returns:
        A new sentence with the default properties swapped out.

      • serialize

        public CoreNLPProtos.Sentence serialize()
        Serialize the given sentence (but not the associated document!) into a Protocol Buffer.
        Returns:
        The Protocol Buffer representing this sentence.

      • serialize

        public void serialize(OutputStream out)
               throws IOException
        Write this sentence to an output stream. Internally, this stores the sentence as a protocol buffer, and saves that buffer to the output stream. This method does not close the stream after writing.
        Parameters:
        out - The output stream to write to. The stream is not closed after the method returns.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown from the underlying write() implementation.

      • deserialize

        public static Sentence deserialize(InputStream in)
                            throws IOException
        Read a sentence from an input stream. This does not close the input stream.
        Parameters:
        in - The input stream to deserialize from.
        Returns:
        The next sentence encoded in the input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown by the underlying parse() implementation.
        See Also:
        Document.serialize(java.io.OutputStream)

        public SentenceAlgorithms algorithms()

      • before

        public List<String> before()
        The whitespace before each token in the sentence. This will match after() of the previous token.

      • before

        public String before(int index)
        The whitespace before this token in the sentence. This will match after() of the previous token.

      • after

        public List<String> after()
        The whitespace after each token in the sentence. This will match before() of the next token.

      • after

        public String after(int index)
        The whitespace after this token in the sentence. This will match before() of the next token.

      • tokens

        public List<Token> tokens()
        The tokens in this sentence. Each token class is just a helper for the methods in this class.

      • regexner

        public void regexner(String mappingFile,
                     boolean ignorecase)
        Run RegexNER over this sentence. Note that this is an in place operation, and simply updates the NER tags. Therefore, every time this function is called, it re-runs the annotator!
        Parameters:
        mappingFile - The regexner mapping file.
        ignorecase - If true, run a caseless match on the regexner file.

      • nerTag

        public String nerTag(int index)
        See Also:
        nerTags(java.util.Properties)

      • mentions

        public List<String> mentions(String nerTag)
        Get all mentions of the given NER tag, as a list of surface forms.
        Parameters:
        nerTag - The ner tag to search for, case sensitive.
        Returns:
        A list of surface forms of the entities of this tag. This is using the word(int) function.

      • mentions

        public List<String> mentions()
        Get all mentions of any NER tag, as a list of surface forms.
        Returns:
        A list of surface forms of the entities in this sentence. This is using the word(int) function.

        public Tree parse(Properties props)
        Returns the constituency parse of this sentence.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A parse tree object.

      • parse

        public Tree parse()
        See Also:
        parse(java.util.Properties)

      • governor

        public Optional<Integer> governor(Properties props,
                                  int index,
                                  SemanticGraphFactory.Mode mode)
        Returns the governor of the given index, according to the passed dependency type. The root has index -1.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to use in the parser annotator.
        index - The index of the dependent word ZERO INDEXED. That is, the first word of the sentence is index 0, not 1 as it would be in the SemanticGraph framework.
        mode - The type of dependency to use (e.g., basic, collapsed, collapsed cc processed).
        Returns:
        The index of the governor, if one exists. A value of -1 indicates the root node.

      • governor

        public Optional<Integer> governor(Properties props,
                                  int index)
        See Also:
        governor(java.util.Properties, int, SemanticGraphFactory.Mode)

      • governor

        public Optional<Integer> governor(int index,
                                  SemanticGraphFactory.Mode mode)
        See Also:
        governor(java.util.Properties, int, SemanticGraphFactory.Mode)

      • governor

        public Optional<Integer> governor(int index)
        See Also:
        governor(java.util.Properties, int)

      • governors

        public List<Optional<Integer>> governors(Properties props,
                                         SemanticGraphFactory.Mode mode)
        Returns the governors of a sentence, according to the passed dependency type. The resulting list is of the same size as the original sentence, with each element being either the governor (index), or empty if the node has no known governor. The root has index -1.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to use in the parser annotator.
        mode - The type of dependency to use (e.g., basic, collapsed, collapsed cc processed).
        Returns:
        A list of the (optional) governors of each token in the sentence.

      • governors

        public List<Optional<Integer>> governors(Properties props)
        See Also:
        governors(java.util.Properties, SemanticGraphFactory.Mode)

      • governors

        public List<Optional<Integer>> governors(SemanticGraphFactory.Mode mode)
        See Also:
        governors(java.util.Properties, SemanticGraphFactory.Mode)

        public List<Optional<Integer>> governors()
        See Also:

      • incomingDependencyLabel

        public Optional<String> incomingDependencyLabel(Properties props,
                                                int index,
                                                SemanticGraphFactory.Mode mode)
        Returns the incoming dependency label to a particular index, according to the Basic Dependencies.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to use in the parser annotator.
        index - The index of the dependent word ZERO INDEXED. That is, the first word of the sentence is index 0, not 1 as it would be in the SemanticGraph framework.
        mode - The type of dependency to use (e.g., basic, collapsed, collapsed cc processed).
        Returns:
        The incoming dependency label, if it exists.

      • dependencyGraph

        public SemanticGraph dependencyGraph(Properties props,
                                     SemanticGraphFactory.Mode mode)
        Returns the dependency graph of the sentence, as a raw SemanticGraph object. Note that this method is slower than you may expect, as it has to convert the underlying protocol buffer back into a list of CoreLabels with which to populate the SemanticGraph.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to use for running the dependency parser annotator.
        mode - The type of graph to return (e.g., basic, collapsed, etc).
        Returns:
        The dependency graph of the sentence.

      • dependencyGraph

        public SemanticGraph dependencyGraph(Properties props)
        See Also:
        dependencyGraph(Properties, SemanticGraphFactory.Mode)

        See Also:

        See Also:

      • length

        public int length()
        The length of the sentence, in tokens

      • operators

        public List<Optional<OperatorSpec>> operators(Properties props)
        Get a list of the (possible) Natural Logic operators on each node of the sentence. At each index, the list contains an operator spec if that index is the head word of an operator in the sentence.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to pass to the natural logic annotator.
        Returns:
        A list of Optionals, where each element corresponds to a token in the sentence, and the optional is nonempty if that index is an operator.

      • operators

        public List<Optional<OperatorSpec>> operators()
        See Also:
        operators(Properties)

      • operatorAt

        public Optional<OperatorSpec> operatorAt(Properties props,
                                         int i)
        See Also:
        operators(Properties)

      • operatorAt

        public Optional<OperatorSpec> operatorAt(int i)
        See Also:
        operators(Properties)

      • operatorsNonempty

        public List<OperatorSpec> operatorsNonempty(Properties props)
        Returns the list of non-empty Natural Logic operator specifications. This amounts to the actual list of operators in the sentence. Note that the spans of the operators can be retrieved with OperatorSpec.quantifierBegin and OperatorSpec.quantifierEnd.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to use for the natlog annotator.
        Returns:
        A list of operators in the sentence.

      • operatorsNonempty

        public List<OperatorSpec> operatorsNonempty()
        See Also:
        operatorsNonempty(Properties)

      • natlogPolarities

        public List<Polarity> natlogPolarities(Properties props)
        The Natural Logic notion of polarity for each token in a sentence.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to use for the natural logic annotator.
        Returns:
        A list of Polarity objects, one for each token of the sentence.

      • natlogPolarities

        public List<Polarity> natlogPolarities()
        See Also:
        natlogPolarities(Properties)

      • natlogPolarity

        public Polarity natlogPolarity(Properties props,
                               int index)
        Get the polarity (the Natural Logic notion of polarity) for a given token in the sentence.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to use for the natural logic annotator.
        index - The index to return the polarity of.
        Returns:
        A list of Polarity objects, one for each token of the sentence.

      • natlogPolarity

        public Polarity natlogPolarity(int index)
        See Also:
        natlogPolarity(Properties, int)

      • openieTriples

        public Collection<RelationTriple> openieTriples(Properties props)
        Get the OpenIE triples associated with this sentence. Note that this function may be slower than you would expect, as it has to convert the underlying Protobuf representation back into CoreLabels.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to use for the OpenIE annotator.
        Returns:
        A collection of RelationTriple objects representing the OpenIE triples in the sentence.

      • openieTriples

        public Collection<RelationTriple> openieTriples()
        See Also:
        Sentence@openieTriples(Properties)

      • openie

        public Collection<Quadruple<String,String,String,Double>> openie()
        Get a list of Open IE triples as flat (subject, relation, object, confidence) quadruples. This is substantially faster than returning RelationTriple objects, as it doesn't require converting the underlying representation into CoreLabels; but, it also contains significantly less information about the sentence.
        See Also:
        Sentence@openieTriples(Properties)

      • kbpTriples

        public Collection<RelationTriple> kbpTriples(Properties props)
        Get the KBP triples associated with this sentence. Note that this function may be slower than you would expect, as it has to convert the underlying Protobuf representation back into CoreLabels.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to use for the KBP annotator.
        Returns:
        A collection of RelationTriple objects representing the KBP triples in the sentence.

      • kbpTriples

        public Collection<RelationTriple> kbpTriples()
        See Also:
        Sentence@kbpTriples(Properties)

      • kbp

        public Collection<Quadruple<String,String,String,Double>> kbp()
        Get a list of KBP triples as flat (subject, relation, object, confidence) quadruples. This is substantially faster than returning RelationTriple objects, as it doesn't require converting the underlying representation into CoreLabels; but, it also contains significantly less information about the sentence.
        See Also:
        Sentence@kbpTriples(Properties)

      • sentiment

        public SentimentClass sentiment()
        The sentiment of this sentence (e.g., positive / negative).
        Returns:
        The SentimentClass of this sentence, as an enum value.

        The sentiment of this sentence (e.g., positive / negative).
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to pass to the sentiment classifier.
        Returns:
        The SentimentClass of this sentence, as an enum value.

      • coref

        public Map<Integer,CorefChain> coref()
        Get the coreference chain for just this sentence. Note that this method is actually fairly computationally expensive to call, as it constructs and prunes the coreference data structure for the entire document.
        Returns:
        A coreference chain, but only for this sentence

      • asCoreMap

        @SafeVarargs
public final CoreMap asCoreMap(java.util.function.Function<Sentence,Object>... functions)
        Returns this sentence as a CoreNLP CoreMap object. Note that, importantly, only the fields which have already been called will be populated in the CoreMap! Therefore, this method is generally NOT recommended.
        Parameters:
        functions - A list of functions to call before populating the CoreMap. For example, you can specify mySentence::posTags, and then posTags will be populated.

      • asCoreLabels

        @SafeVarargs
public final List<CoreLabel> asCoreLabels(java.util.function.Function<Sentence,Object>... functions)
        Returns this sentence as a list of CoreLabels representing the sentence. Note that, importantly, only the fields which have already been called will be populated in the CoreMap! Therefore, this method is generally NOT recommended.
        Parameters:
        functions - A list of functions to call before populating the CoreMap. For example, you can specify mySentence::posTags, and then posTags will be populated.

      • rawToken

        public CoreNLPProtos.Token.Builder rawToken(int i)
        A helper to get the raw Protobuf builder for a given token. Primarily useful for cache checks.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the token to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A Protobuf builder for that token.

      • rawSentence

        public CoreNLPProtos.Sentence.Builder rawSentence()
        Get the backing protocol buffer for this sentence.
        Returns:
        The raw backing protocol buffer builder for this sentence.

      • updateTokens

        protected <E> void updateTokens(List<CoreLabel> tokens,
                                java.util.function.Consumer<Pair<CoreNLPProtos.Token.Builder,E>> setter,
                                java.util.function.Function<CoreLabel,E> getter)
        Update each token in the sentence with the given information.
        Type Parameters:
        E - The type of the given field we are setting in the protocol buffer and reading from the CoreLabel.
        Parameters:
        tokens - The CoreNLP tokens returned by the Annotator.
        setter - The function to set a Protobuf object with the given field.
        getter - The function to get the given field from the CoreLabel.
